Commerical Activities

Responsible for managing strategic communications and public relations initiatives

Department

Commerical Activities

Responsible for managing strategic communications and public relations initiatives

Commercial Activities works closely on both ongoing and future partnerships with the ASUC and UC Berkeley students. Our department ensures that important platforms, such as the Wall Street Journal and the New York Times, remain accessible to students. Beyond maintaining these existing relationships, we also explore and establish new partnerships with platforms that are heavily used by students, broadening the range of resources available to the campus community....

New York Times

Get free access to a variety of New York Times articles, games, and podcasts if you are an undergraduate or graduate student.

Register

Wall Street Journal

Get free access to a variety of New York Times articles, games, and podcasts if you are an undergraduate or graduate student.

Register
Commercial Activities and Student Services Agreement (CASSA)

What is CSSA?

PurposePast Examples of CSSA FundingHow Does CSSA Funding Work?Who Can Propose Initiatives?

The Commercial Activities and Student Services Agreement (CASSA) between the University of California, Berkeley (UCB), the ASUC, and the GA outlines how the ASUC's commercial activities support student services and programs: 

Partner Feedback Form

Form for students to list what partnerships they want from the university, what increased functions/access they want from each app.

Our Ongoing Work

The OEVP provides free access to newspaper subscriptions such as the Wall Street Journal and New York Times, and financial grants.
